fields.title: Experience
fields.description: General overview of the experience

content.value: When entering the website, the user shakes their mobile phone, and the generic phone in the browser will start to shake, break apart, and reveal the Galaxy S8.
The phone is a 3D model the user can touch to rotate and zoom to play. The 3D S8 model also tilts as the user tilts their own phone.

fields.title: Results
fields.description: 4 global TV commercials inspired by the generative expressions

content.value: This work represents an immense success as the code-generated expressions have been transformed into a commercially viable campaign with global impact. The success affirms the importance of collaboration and partnership between design and technology, even for more traditional mediums like commercials.

The executive creative director of the Samsung account in R/GA recounted that our work contributed significantly to the campaign development. As a result, the Mill made four commercials for the campaign. The outcome was heavily based on the generative expressions, and the four commercials ran across globally for several months.

I need to highlight one prototype embodying flock behavioral systems. It was developed with openFrameworks from studies of schools of swarming fish behaviors and fluid simulation algorithms. It exudes converging, dispersing, and intermixing patterns.

fields.title: Further Exploration
fields.description: Turning discoveries of natural elements into generative expressions

content.value: Based on the horizon and seascape metaphor, air and water elements were mapped as thematic concepts for the generative expressions. The air and water elements were ordered sequentially — galaxy, fog, smoke, airflow, droplet, meander, wave, and swarm.

fields.title: Prototyping
fields.description: Prototypes translating natural landscapes into generative expressions.

content.value: The Dichotomies merged to create a feel of seamlessness, so we told our S narrative through two expressions, a nature-inspired and a tech art expression. One speaks for the reality and the present. The other for the imagination and the possibilities. Both forces as one.

fields.title: Background
fields.description: To depict universality based on superior appeal and functionality of the Galaxy S8.

content.value: Galaxy S8 smartphone features a beautiful, borderless "infinity" screen and a constantly-learning AI assistant that can dive deep into your universe of apps to connect reminders, events, contacts, and behaviors, providing simplicity and visibility to daily activity.

R/GA was tasked with providing an identity design, serving as a scalable design system for the Samsung Galaxy S8 launch campaign and representing limitless connectivity, limitless learning, and limitless visibility of the new device.

fields.title: S8 Campaign Launch Identity - Final Commercial Video - Fish

content.value: The website is designed with Figma and implemented with Vue.js and Nuxt.js frameworks for better performance and stability. The home page is a web canvas showing Three.js animations and interactions. The other pages are composed of modular components customized based on Vuetify.js, where data from Contentful fully control all the content and page layout.

From the project, I thoroughly learned the standard approach from one of the world’s top tech companies for code review, unit tests, website development, and deployment. At the same time, by learning Google’s standards, I deepened my understanding of Google’s comprehensive design system and honed my programming skills in general.
Its original website was built on legacy code and architecture. Its complete-bespoke CSS and components, and lack of CMS result in high rates of regression and constant need for maintenance.

I built the entire infrastructure independently as it is the first time for R/GA APAC to integrate Alibaba Cloud cloud services into the workflow. The website is also one of the first steps to establish the R/GA's lean stack offering in Asia-Pacific.

fields.title: Team Kaleidoscope
fields.description: The first time for R/GA APAC to integrate Alibaba Cloud services.

fields.title: Kaleidoscope - The ask from the team

content.value: The ask from the team is to provide a secure/restricted web portal that allows the team to iterate over design and content continuously with minimum cost. Based on the request, we implemented a static single-page microsite with a login screen, which adopts the headless CMS (contentful) and serverless infrastructure to have the best flexibility, security, usability, and lowest cost (almost $0 running cost).

fields.title: mood - Maker Faire Recording
fields.description: New York Maker Faire 2015

fields.title: mood - Audiences at these exhibitions expressed significant

content.value: Audiences at these exhibitions expressed significant interest and provided positive feedback. Some even remarked that this music player revolutionizes the music player industry by serving as a more profound bridge between the audience and music, fostering greater human connection compared to other devices.

fields.title: Innovation
fields.description: A system using 5 sensors to achieve position detection in a space

fields.title: mood - Instead of using light-sensing technology

content.value: Instead of using light-sensing technology like in an optical mouse, which would not allow users to lift the music player above the table, I opted for Radio Frequency (RF) Sensors after conducting research. At the core of this technology is an RF emitter that continuously emits radio waves. These waves travel through space and their signal strength changes with distance. A corresponding RF receiver captures these altered waves and determines the distance to the emitter.

fields.title: mood - LED loop
fields.description: LED lights illuminating in a sequential loop

fields.title: Development
fields.description: 3D Printing + Hardware Prototyping + MIDI Control System + Customized Music Tracks

fields.title: mood - As for the music, we collaborated with a digital music composer

content.value: As for the music, we collaborated with a digital music composer to create 16 tracks, encompassing bass, beats, drums, and main melodies in 4 distinct styles. These tracks can seamlessly blend with each other while maintaining musical harmony.
How to play the demo below:
Click the "play demo" button to load the demo
Optional: Click the "full screen" button to open the demo in a new tab.
In the demo, click the play icon to start playing the music.
Drag the knob to adjust the mood of the music.
Click the knob to switch between 4 different music tracks.

fields.title: Prototyping
fields.description: A rapid prototype in web version was developed to test the usability.

fields.title: mood - We designed the music player to be a cylindrical shape

content.value: We designed the music player to be a cylindrical shape in white color, positioned on top of a square table that functions as the square playground in the prototype. Each corner of the table represents a unique style, and the distance between the music player and the corner determines the extent to which that style influences the final music. Users can stand in front of the table, move the music player on the table, and hear the blended music emanating from the table.

fields.title: mood - We proceeded to use p5.js to create a rapid prototype in web version

content.value: We proceeded to use p5.js to create a rapid prototype in web version. The prototype features a square playground where users can move the circular knob around to change the pace, tone, pitch, and explore different combinations of music tracks, resulting in music of various moods.

I developed this system to explore such a possibility. Using XBee and 3D printing, I created this ball-shaped wireless heart rate monitor, which constantly sends real-time data to computers. With the video player I built with Chrome extension, the audience can actively affect the combination of movie clips by changing their heart rate. The higher their heart rate is, the more intense the spot will be.

fields.title: Prototyping
fields.description: Quick iterations while valuing the craft within both design and technology

content.value: The concept of harmony and the primary interaction model inspired the microcontroller design, including its material selection and sensor engineering. Its circuitry, industrial and interaction designs were optimized from multiple user feedback. This was crucial to achieving a balance between form and function.

On the web version, I utilized P5.js and Tone.js libraries for music playback. For this physical version, I opted for Processing and Beats (a MIDI control software) to dynamically adjust the pace and pitch of the music on the fly.

In the following scenes, users can see nature scenery inside the infinity display, tilt their phone and pan around. Users can touch and trigger animations of S8's rear camera, taking a picture and saving it to the secured folder. All the animations were done with CSS to minimize the asset size. The water resistance scene uses various kinds of shader rendering, such as God Ray, distortion, to create a realistic underwater view. The 3D phone is a colliding entity that can bounce other 3D bubbles away.

fields.title: mood - The biggest challenge of the development

content.value: The biggest challenge of the development is detecting the movement and position of the music player relative to the table.
R/GA New York showcased these generative expressions to the CMO of Samsung USA. He and his team were thoroughly impressed.

fields.title: Kaleidoscope - Website built for R/GA’s pitch

content.value: “Team Kaleidoscope” is a website built for R/GA’s pitch for the University of Melbourne.

We based the identity system on a generative design technique. Most of the explorations are based on the number 8, which is also a vertical symbol of infinity, a symbol of harmony and balance, with no ending and loops back upon itself.

Regarding the exterior design, we utilized 3D printing to create the case of the music player. The case features a ring of white LED lights mounted on its middle layer. The microcontroller inside the case controls the LED lights to illuminate in a sequential loop.

Equilibrium was developed from three iterations of design and development. Multiple user tests were conducted to inform the refinements for the next few iterations. A step by step tutorial was added to the user flow to help familiarize players with the gameplay, clarifying the game objectives and its rewards.

fields.title: mood - Starting from a class in ITP

content.value: Starting from a class in ITP called interactive music, we had an idea of creating an adaptive music player that allows users to intuitively find music best suited to their current mood.

fields.title: mood - The 'm o o d' music player was initially showcased

content.value: The 'm o o d' music player was initially showcased at the ITP Spring Show 2015 hosted by NYU ITP. Subsequently, it was selected for exhibition at major interactive media events, such as the New York Maker Faire 2015 and the NYC Arcade 2015.

fields.title: Prototyping - Explanation of the Initial Prototypes

content.value: Based on this concept, we developed multiple prototypes translating natural landscapes into generative expressions.

Custom installation sequences were designed to showcase the portraits, its generative expressions and corresponding metadata, displayed in real time on multiple screens positioned on the exterior of the installation. They were also showcased on the gigantic atrium wall within the 837 flagship space.

Based on the interaction and material characteristics of the Guzheng, a game design and microcontroller prototypes were developed. The game requires two players to interact with a physical interface (pressure sensitive string connected to sensors) to emit digital waveforms to hit an onscreen target simultaneously.

I was responsible for building this serverless infrastructure using Alibaba Cloud services, which handle user authentication, password encryption, access control of frontend developers, and CMS content retrieving & processing.

fields.title: mood - I am utilizing Moteino R4 with RFM69W 915MHz as my RF sensors

content.value: I am utilizing Moteino R4 with RFM69W 915MHz as my RF sensors. I have embedded an RF emitter inside the music player and placed one RF receiver at each corner of the table. By analyzing the signal strength received by each RF receiver (with certain noise filtering), I am able to calculate the relative position of the music player on the table.

From this, we carried out investigations into the movements and textures of these eight elements. The discoveries contributed to prototypes of generative expressions, maintaining cyclical movements in the form of S, 8, and infinity while mirroring a continuum that connects the digital and physical worlds.

Inspired by Hiroshi Sugimoto’s seascapes series, the horizon suggests the coexistence of two worlds in harmony. The horizon line represents the perfect metaphor for the Galaxy S8, acting as a conduit between imagination and reality.

The portrait features movements connected motion blurs created by a long exposure photographic technique. Our generative software mimics the users’ movements by employing the perlin noise algorithm to generate abstractions of visual motion akin to stochastic painting techniques.

The website displays an interactive 3D model of the Samsung Galaxy S8. It allows users to trigger and explore the new phone features, including infinity display, iris scanner, Bixby vision, autofocus camera, and water resistant. In this way, users can become familiar with the highlight features of the new Samsung Galaxy S8 and pre-order.
